conclusion: The conveyor belt is moving clockwise at a speed of v=6 m/s.
The distance between the two drive wheels M and N is L1=10 m.
An object with mass m=3 kg is placed on the conveyor belt directly above wheel M.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is Î¼=0.3.
The task is to find the work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N.
The object is placed gently, implying it starts with the same velocity as the conveyor belt.
Since the object moves with the conveyor belt at the same speed, there is no relative motion between them.
No relative motion means no kinetic friction acts on the object.
If no kinetic friction acts, the work done by frictional force is zero.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object is 0 Joules.
